file_content.text: I'm sorry--I can't talk right now.
You--you came back. Do you have the medicine?
That's every last medkit--seems the separatists didn't live long enough to make much use of them.
Here you go.
This is going to make a huge difference. Really, it's nice to find someone with a good heart here on Ord Mantell. Thank you.
I was starting to lose faith that there were any good people left.
It was nothing.
A little bit goes a long way.
There are still lots of good people in the galaxy.
Don't give up hope.
Maybe. It just seems like there aren't very many on Ord Mantell, I guess.
I know. We're a rare breed.
I am special.
Uh, right.
Thank you again.
Uh, no, not yet. But you'll be the first to know when I do.
[Lie] Not yet.
Please hurry. This is a matter of life and death!
I know, Ryso. We're all hurting, but it's going to be okay.
I'm sorry, Ryso. I don't have any medicine for you today.
It hurts!
I know, but there's nothing I can do right now. I'm sorry, honey.
Hi. Sorry, I didn't mean to ignore you, it's just crazy around here right now. What brings you to the camp?
Someone stole some medicine. I'm looking for the thief.
Thief hunting.
We're looking for some medicine that was stolen from the fort. You wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you?
Republic business.
Just doing what we all do, working for credits. Today's job: medicine retrieval and delivery.
Making money.
I work as a Republic doctor up in Fort Garnik, and we have an unexpected shortage of medicine.
[Lie] I'm a doctor.
You don't look much like a doctor. Can I see some credentials?
Just let me get them. I know they're in here somewhere.
Of course.
I serve the Republic, ma'am. I don't need credentials.
I'm a Republic soldier.
Credentials? Well, that's a funny story, see. Shortly after I landed here, my ship was stolen and my credentials were on board. So....
They were in my ship.
Nevermind, I know the real reason you're here. The sleeping guard sent you... yeah, I took the medicine.
I'm looking for stolen medicine.
I'll be honest with you.
Ah, the sleeping guard must have sent you. Yeah, I saw the guard sleeping at his post--and I took the medicine, too.
It's no use trying to cover it up. See, I took the supplies to help the refugees. More and more of them are dying everyday. The Republic won't help.
So when I saw the guard sleeping, I helped myself, but then the separatists took the medicine from me. Now they have it, and we don't.
What now?
I'm not sure. See, I can tell you where the separatists went, but I need to know that you'll bring the medicine to me.
Fantastic.
Hey, look, I--I didn't start this war. I didn't leave these kids orphaned. I'm just trying to make the best of it.
So the thief got a taste of her own, er, medicine.
What comes around....
Haha. Funny.
So here's the deal: You agree to bring the supplies to me so I can give them to the refugees, and I'll tell you which way the separatists went.
Unless, of course, you'd rather the separatists keep the medicine.
You wouldn't.
This isn't a game. I'm serious.
What's in it for me?
If I could pay you to bring the medicine back, I wouldn't have stolen it in the first place.
How about you tell me where they went and I don't kill you?
Don't make this hard.
I told you--your threats will have no effect on me.
I'm tired of being bullied because I don't carry a gun. If the war doesn't drive people out of their homes, the soldiers come and extort money out of them.
Sometimes, someone's driven out only to be robbed--"taxed," they call it--on the way here. But they won't suffer for lack of medicine. Not if I can help it.
I'll bring you the medicine.
Okay, you win.
Sorry for the guilt trip, but I hope you realize you're doing the right thing. Ryso here, at least, will be grateful.
The separatists fled to Talloran village. Please hurry, there are people here in critical condition.
Be right back.
This should be easy.
Good. I look forward to your arrival. Thank you.
Let's get this over with.
I'll take what I can get.
Tell me where the medicine is or the kid dies.
No deal. [Threaten the child]
Damn you, you butchers.
Fine. The separatists who ambushed me fled to Talloran village. They usually gather at the town center. Have the damn medicine.
Thanks.
You did the right thing.
I did what I had to.
Just get out of here. You've caused enough trouble.
How can the Republic expect us to get by with so few supplies?
